document.docAuthor: Michat, Mariano C., Alarie, Yves & Watts, Chris H. S.
document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions of the first-instar larva of the hypogaeic species Neobidessodes limestoneensis (Watts & Humphreys) and of the third-instar larva of Hydroglyphus balkei Hendrich (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae: Bidessini) with phylogenetic considerations

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions of the first-instar larva of the hypogaeic species Neobidessodes limestoneensis (Watts & Humphreys) and of the third-instar larva of Hydroglyphus balkei Hendrich (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae: Bidessini) with phylogenetic considerations

subSubSection.paragraph:
Source of material. Australia , Yilgarn, WA; Limestone Well, Three Rivers Station,
25 ° 16 ’ 59 ’’S
,
119 ° 10 ’ 33 ’’E
,
26 /viii/ 2001
; W. F. Humphreys, T. Karanovic & J. M. Waldock (Watts & Humphreys 2003 ).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Measurements and ratios for the larvae of
Neobidessodes limestoneensis
and
Hydroglyphus balkei
. Measure
Neobidessodes Hydroglyphus
Measure Neobidessodes Hydroglyphus

subSubSection.paragraph: HL (mm) 1.00 0.78–0.80 MP 2 /MP 3 3.67 2.55 –3.00 Description. Color. Uniformly pale, unpigmented, distal half of mandible light brown.

Body. Relatively soft, lightly sclerotized, subcylindrical, narrowing towards abdominal apex. Measurements and ratios that characterize the body shape are shown in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–14.
Neobidessodes limestoneensis
, first-instar larva. 1, cephalic capsule, dorsal aspect; 2, cephalic capsule, ventral aspect; 3, antenna, dorsal aspect; 4, antenna, ventral aspect; 5, mandible, dorsal aspect; 6, maxilla, dorsal aspect; 7, maxilla, ventral aspect; 8, labium, dorsal aspect; 9, labium, ventral aspect; 10, metathoracic leg, anterior aspect; 11, metathoracic leg, posterior aspect; 12, abdominal segment VIII, ventral aspect; 13, abdominal segment VIII, dorsal aspect; 14, urogomphus, dorsal aspect. EB, egg burster; Sp, spinula; TP, tentorial pit. Scale bars = 0.10 mm.
